page.title: 03FLECKNEY PRIMARY SCHOOL PAST
page.content: FLECKNEY PRIMARY SCHOOL PAST The C.ofE. primary school was built in 1873. By then all children under 10 had to go to school.The 5 room school had to accommodate 330 children. The school was extended in 1973 due to the expanding village and overcrowded conditions in the school. The extension(larger than the original building) had to be built on a new estate neat the edge of the village. Allthe infants remained at the old building and there are no plans to have the children at one site. The old building is considered adequate. The extension itself has had mobile classrooms added. This information was the result of an interview with the Headteache
